alert.note: Alert for Greene; Putnam (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 4:06AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Putnam and southeastern Greene Counties through 445 AM EDT... At 406 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Reynolds at Lake Oconee, or 8 miles southwest of Greensboro, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Greensboro, White Plains, Siloam, Phoenix, Reynolds at Lake Oconee, Liberty, Veazey and Carey. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
